item.title: Cheat Sheet: How Smart Chefs Use Spices to Make Summer Recipes Even Better
item.description: Add a dash of dazzle to peak produce and radically simple, no-oven recipes. With these key tips, you’ll streamline your spice rack and season like a pro.

item.title: Could the U.S. Have Ended World War II With a 'Demonstration' Bomb?
item.description: In 1945, American leaders debated whether to drop an atomic bomb in an unpopulated area to intimidate Japan into surrendering.

item.title: Election in 2020 Fueled Crisis of Democracy. Voters Fear Repeat in 2024.
item.description: Many Republicans believe that Trump beat Biden and that the next election will be stolen, while Democrats expect another GOP effort to overturn results.

item.title: The Teamsters Boss Who Calls Himself S.O.B.
item.description: Sean O’Brien’s tough tactics resulted in a deal with UPS and a defeat at Yellow.

item.title: Ukraine Struggles to Retake Bakhmut From Dogged Russian Fighters
item.description: Soldiers say advances have slowed in recent days against Russian defenses and counterattacks, denting hopes that Kyiv could soon retake the pivotal city.

item.title: Another Big Chinese Property Domino Is Wobbling
item.description: Bonds of Country Garden, China’s largest developer by contracted sales, have been in free fall.

item.title: Tank Tops, Toilet Trips and Lies: What Headhunters Can See
item.description: Recruiters share their wildest stories from working with applicants seeking jobs and the companies considering hiring them.

item.title: A Texas judge blocked the state from enforcing abortion bans against women facing serious pregnancy complications, saying essential care has been denied.
item.description: A Texas judge blocked the state from enforcing abortion bans against women facing serious pregnancy complications, saying essential care has been denied.

item.title: Russia's leading opposition figure, Alexei Navalny, was sentenced to a further 19 years in prison.
item.description: Russia’s leading opposition figure, Alexei Navalny, was sentenced to a further 19 years in prison.

item.title: The Supreme Court let stand a lower court order exempting American Indians from a range of local laws in Tulsa, Okla.
item.description: The Supreme Court let stand a lower court order exempting American Indians from a range of local laws in Tulsa, Okla.

item.title: Ukraine struck one of Russia's largest ports with naval drones, disrupting shipments of grain and oil as fighting intensified in the Black Sea.
item.description: Ukraine struck one of Russia’s largest ports with naval drones, disrupting shipments of grain and oil as fighting intensified in the Black Sea.

item.title: The first pill to treat post-pregnancy depression will soon be available, after the Food and Drug Administration approved it.
item.description: The first pill to treat post-pregnancy depression will soon be available, after the Food and Drug Administration approved it.

item.title: Colombia's president has embarked on a bilateral cease-fire with the country's oldest rebel group.
item.description: Colombia's president has embarked on a bilateral cease-fire with the country’s oldest rebel group.

item.title: The U.S. said it had frozen some of its foreign assistance to Niger, as tensions heightened over the detention of the country's president.
item.description: The U.S. said it had frozen some of its foreign assistance to Niger, as tensions heightened over the detention of the country’s president.

item.title: What's News: World-Wide
item.description: What’s News: World-Wide

item.title: Icahn Enterprises said it was cutting its dividend in half to $1 a share, the first reduction since 2011, amid an activist short seller's campaign against the company.
item.description: Icahn Enterprises said it was cutting its dividend in half to $1 a share, the first reduction since 2011, amid an activist short seller’s campaign against the company.

item.title: Nikola CEO Michael Lohscheller has stepped down due to a family health matter, and Chairman Steve Girsky has taken over the role.
item.description: Nikola CEO Michael Lohscheller has stepped down due to a family health matter, and Chairman Steve Girsky has taken over the role.

item.title: Saudi Arabia is increasingly driving an oil-production strategy to boost prices that is at odds with other OPEC members.
item.description: Saudi Arabia is increasingly driving an oil-production strategy to boost prices that is at odds with other OPEC members.

item.title: A federal judge narrowed a major antitrust case against Alphabet's Google ahead of a trial that is slated to begin next month, rejecting an argument made by a bipartisan group of 38 state attorneys general who sued the tech giant in 2020 over its search dominance.
item.description: A federal judge narrowed a major antitrust case against Alphabet’s Google ahead of a trial that is slated to begin next month, rejecting an argument made by a bipartisan group of 38 state attorneys general who sued the tech giant in 2020 over its search dominance.

item.title: Employers slowed their hiring this summer, adding to signs the economy is gradually cooling and easing pressure for the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates at its next meeting.
item.description: Employers slowed their hiring this summer, adding to signs the economy is gradually cooling and easing pressure for the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates at its next meeting.
